::Shadow Wing::

She looked at him. "NO. I'm not that bad. I just can't fly for a 
little while.  My wing will heal soon. Then I can fly. Just because 
I'm grounded doesn't mean I'm totally helpless. Besides, why risk 
another bot in this storm.  I can walk." The snow was easing up but 
the lightening was more frequent now.  She started walking southward 
and headed for the base.  
She turned and looked at him. "I'm sorry that I am no fighter.  I'm 
sorry that I was a dissapointment. But I can't go any furhter than 
what I was programmed to do. I Recon. And now I know that's all I'll 
ever be good for. If that even." She knew that he was a fighter and a 
surviver. She knew he was more wolf than machine.  That he needed to 
be with others of his own kind.  And she knew that she wasn't 
anything like him or what he needed a partner to be.  She turned and 
started walking again. She would be lucky to have him for a friend.  
She wanted to be better than she was.  And all she proved was that 
she was less than what she thought she was originally.  


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> (This is for 5971 too)
> Lunarpine looked at her, she couldn't transform? things just kept 
> getting better.(Sarcasm)
> "How bad is it?"Lunarpine asked with concern in his eyes. "Can you 
> still move yourself or do you need help?"
> He wasn't disapointed at her for getting hurt, he was disapointed 
in 
> her for running (Flying) away. He could tell this unit had no 
> discipline, or order. 
> 
> "Lunarpine to base, I found Shadow Wing, she's injured and we need 
an 
> airlift home."
> 
> Lunarpine now realized that this team wasn't a fighting unit but 
more 
> of a unit of friends trying to survive.
> 
> "OK Wing lets get walking, we'll meet our transportation half way."
>
